what: Basic implementation of the plotting functions
title: Basic Design Of The Plots
text: plotting functions plotthis implemented following structure:
code: SomePlot <- function(     data,     # The column to split the data and plot     # When `facet` is TRUE, the columns specified here will be used to facet the plot     # When `facet` is FALSE, the columns specified here will be used to split the data     #   and generate multiple plots and combine them into one     # If multiple columns are specified     #   When `facet` is TRUE, up to 2 columns are allowed. If one column,     #     `ggplot2::facet_wrap` is used, the number of rows and columns is determined     #     by `nrow` and `ncol`     #   When `facet` is FALSE, a warning will be issued and the columns will be     #     concatenated into one column, using `split_by_sep` as the separator     split_by, split_by_sep,     # Columns to group the data for plotting     # For those plotting functions that do not support multiple groups,     # They will be concatenated into one column, using `group_by_sep` as the separator     group_by, group_by_sep,     # Whether to facet the plot, or split the data and combine the plots     facet, facet_scales,     # Controls for theming     theme, theme_args, palette, palcolor, keep_empty, x_text_angle, aspect.ratio,     legend.position, legend.direction, alpha, title, subtitle, xlab, ylab,     # The number of rows and columns when `facet_wrap` is used or     # when `facet` is FALSE, the number of rows and columns to combine the plots     # For facet_wrap, dir = 'v' will be used when byrow = FALSE     combine, nrow, ncol, byrow     # Whether to guess the width and height of the plot in pixels     # list(plot, width, height) will be returned instead of the plot if TRUE     seed,     ... ) {      # Argument validation      # Data preparation     #   Data will be transformed based on the arguments     #   and split into a list of data frames by split_by      # Plot for each split data frame     plots <- lapply(split_data, function(df) {         # Calling atomic plotting functions to generate the plot         #   These functions do not need to handle split         #   All data passed to these functions should feed to the plot         SomePlotAtomic(df, ...)     })      # Combine the plots     #     patch_work::wrap_plots(plots, nrow, ncol, byrow) }

title: Basic Design Of The Plots
text: Unlike plotting packages, plotthis provides unified interface splitting faceting. plots created ggplot2 behind scenes, plotthis “facet-aware”. plotting functions plotthis support splitting faceting. split_by argument used split data generate multiple plots. facet argument used facet plot. facet TRUE, split_by columns used facet plot. facet FALSE, split_by columns used split data generate multiple plots, combined one plot. faceting, facet_scales argument used control scales facets. facet_wrap function used split_by one column; otherwise, facet_grid function used split_by two columns. splitting, data split split_by columns split plotted separately. plot scales guides. Unlike faceting, scales guides shared plots.

title: Basic Design Of The Plots
text: arguments plotting functions named consistent way. _ used separate words argument names, favor ., unless argument passed ggplot2 function (e.g. theme). _ used separate words argument names make argument names readable less confusing . function names, work method call. argument names lowercase.

title: Basic Design Of The Plots
text: plots created plotthis come height width attribute. experimental feature used guess size plot inches. Note actual size plot. just guess based elements plot. can use values set fig.width fig.height arguments chunk options R Markdown options(repr.plot.width = ...) options(repr.plot.height = ...) Jupyter notebooks. can also use save plot file guessed size. example:
code: p <- SomePlot(x, ...) png("plot.png", width = attr(p, "width") * 100, height = attr(p, "height") * 100, res = 100) print(p) dev.off()

title: Basic Design Of The Plots
text: extra data needed plotting, plotthis usually provides argument receive . can prepare data attached attribute main data frame, pass @extra argument. function can access extra data attr(data, "extra"). example:
code: data <- gsea_result attr(data, "gene_ranks") <- gene_ranks attr(data, "gene_sets") <- gene_sets GSEAPlot(data)  # Equivalent to GSEAPlot(data, gene_ranks = gene_ranks, gene_sets = gene_sets)

See split_by group_by Columns group data plotting plotting functions support multiple groups, concatenated one column, using group_by_sep separator group_by_sep separator multiple group_by columns. See group_by group_name character string name legend fill. scale_y logical value scale y-axis total number x-axis group. theme character string theme class (.e. ggplot2::theme_classic) specifying theme use. Default "theme_this". theme_args list arguments pass theme function. palette character string specifying palette use. palcolor character string specifying color use palette. alpha numeric value specifying transparency plot. facet_by character string specifying column name data frame facet plot. Otherwise, data split split_by generate multiple plots combine one using patchwork::wrap_plots facet_scales Whether scale axes facets. Default "fixed" options "free", "free_x", "free_y". See ggplot2::facet_wrap facet_ncol numeric value specifying number columns facet. facet_by single column facet_wrap used. facet_nrow numeric value specifying number rows facet. facet_by single column facet_wrap used. facet_byrow logical value indicating whether fill plots row. Default TRUE. x_text_angle numeric value specifying angle x-axis text. aspect.ratio numeric value specifying aspect ratio plot. legend.position character string specifying position legend. waiver(), single groups, legend "none", otherwise "right". legend.direction character string specifying direction legend. title character string specifying title plot. function can used generate title based default title. useful split_by used title needs dynamic. subtitle character string specifying subtitle plot. xlab character string specifying x-axis label. ylab character string specifying y-axis label. keep_empty logical value indicating whether keep empty groups. FALSE, empty groups removed. seed random seed use. Default 8525. combine Whether combine plots one facet FALSE. Default TRUE. nrow numeric value specifying number rows facet. ncol numeric value specifying number columns facet. byrow logical value indicating whether fill plots row. ... Additional arguments.

code: set.seed(8525) data <- data.frame(    x = c(rnorm(250, -1), rnorm(250, 1)),    group = rep(LETTERS[1:5], each = 100) ) RidgePlot(data, x = "x", group_by = "group") #> Picking joint bandwidth of 0.378  RidgePlot(data, x = "x", group_by = "group", reverse = TRUE) #> Picking joint bandwidth of 0.378   # wide form data_wide <- data.frame(    A = rnorm(100),    B = rnorm(100),    C = rnorm(100),    D = rnorm(100),    E = rnorm(100),    group = sample(letters[1:4], 100, replace = TRUE) ) RidgePlot(data_wide, group_by = LETTERS[1:5], in_form = "wide") #> Picking joint bandwidth of 0.337  RidgePlot(data_wide, group_by = LETTERS[1:5], in_form = "wide", facet_by = "group") #> Picking joint bandwidth of 0.429 #> Picking joint bandwidth of 0.367 #> Picking joint bandwidth of 0.416 #> Picking joint bandwidth of 0.428 #> Picking joint bandwidth of 0.429 #> Picking joint bandwidth of 0.367 #> Picking joint bandwidth of 0.416 #> Picking joint bandwidth of 0.428

code: data <- data.frame(     x = c("A", "B", "C", "D", "E", "F", "G", "H"),     y = c(10, 8, 16, 4, 6, 12, 14, 2),     group = c("G1", "G1", "G2", "G2", "G3", "G3", "G4", "G4"),     facet = c("F1", "F2", "F3", "F4", "F1", "F2", "F3", "F4") )  BarPlot(data, x = "x", y = "y")  BarPlot(data, x = "x", y = "y", fill_by_x_if_no_group = FALSE)  BarPlot(data, x = "x", y = "y", label = TRUE)  BarPlot(data, x = "x", y = "y", label = "facet", label_nudge = 1)  BarPlot(data, x = "group", y = "y", group_by = "x")  BarPlot(data,     x = "group", y = "y", group_by = "x",     position = "dodge", add_bg = TRUE )  BarPlot(data,     x = "x", y = "y", split_by = "group",     facet_by = "facet", position = "dodge", facet_ncol = 1 )  BarPlot(data,     x = "group", y = "y", group_by = "x",     position = "dodge", add_bg = TRUE, bg_palette = "Spectral" )  # use the count BarPlot(data, x = "group", ylab = "count")  # flip the plot BarPlot(data, x = "group", flip = TRUE, ylab = "count")  data <- data.frame(     word = c("apple", "banana", "cherry", "date", "elderberry",              "It is a very long term with a lot of words"),     count = c(-10, 20, -30, 40, 50, 34),     score = c(1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 3.2),     group = c("A", "A", "B", "B", "C", "C") ) SplitBarPlot(data, x = "count", y = "word", alpha_by = "score")  SplitBarPlot(data, x = "count", y = "word", alpha_by = "score",              max_charwidth = 30, lineheight = 1.1)  SplitBarPlot(data, x = "count", y = "word", fill_by = "group")  SplitBarPlot(data, x = "count", y = "word", facet_by = "group",              fill_name = "Direction")

title: VennDiagram — PrepareVennData
text: data data frame list VennPlotData object. in_form character string indicating datatype input data. Possible values "long", "wide", "list", "venn" NULL. "long" indicates data long format. "wide" indicates data wide format. "list" indicates data list. "venn" indicates data VennPlotData object. NULL indicates function detect datatype input data. long format data look like: wide format data look like: list format data look like: group_by character string specifying column name data frame group data. group_by_sep character string concatenate columns group_by, multiple columns provided in_form "long". id_by character string specifying column name data frame identify instances. Required group_by single column data data frame. split_by column(s) split data plot separately. split_by_sep separator multiple split_by columns. See split_by label character string specifying label show Venn diagram. Possible values "count", "percent", "", "none". "count" indicates count intersection. "percent" indicates percentage intersection. "" indicates count percentage intersection. "none" indicates label. label_fg character string specifying color label text. label_size numeric value specifying size label text. label_bg character string specifying background color label. label_bg_r numeric value specifying radius background label. fill_mode character string specifying fill mode Venn diagram. Possible values "count", "set", "count_rev". "count" indicates fill color based count intersection. "set" indicates fill color based set intersection. "count_rev" indicates fill color based count intersection reverse order. palette continuous "count" "count_rev". palette discrete "set". fill_name character string name legend colorbar. palette character string specifying palette use. palcolor character string specifying color use palette. alpha numeric value specifying transparency plot. theme character string theme class (.e. ggplot2::theme_classic) specifying theme use. Default "theme_this". theme_args list arguments pass theme function. title character string specifying title plot. function can used generate title based default title. useful split_by used title needs dynamic. subtitle character string specifying subtitle plot. legend.position character string specifying position legend. waiver(), single groups, legend "none", otherwise "right". legend.direction character string specifying direction legend. combine Whether combine plots one facet FALSE. Default TRUE. nrow numeric value specifying number rows facet. ncol numeric value specifying number columns facet. byrow logical value indicating whether fill plots row. seed random seed use. Default 8525. ... Additional arguments.
